intro: Tetratheca thymifolia var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and inland regions. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
